title: Eldridge Cleaver, Black Panther
text: Eldridge Cleaver, Black Panther is an Algerian documentary film made in 1969 and directed by <a href="William%20Klein%20%28photographer%29">William Klein</a>. The film covers <a href="Black%20Panther%20Party">Black Panther</a> activist <a href="Eldridge%20Cleaver">Eldridge Cleaver</a> while exiled in Algeria. Cleaver moved to Algeria after the U.S. state of <a href="California">California</a> tried to charge him with intent to murder. In the documentary, Cleaver discusses revolution in the United States and denounces political figures <a href="Richard%20Nixon">Richard Nixon</a>, <a href="Spiro%20Agnew">Spiro Agnew</a>, <a href="Ronald%20Reagan">Ronald Reagan</a> and <a href="Richard%20J.%20Daley">Richard J. Daley</a>.
